sourceMeaningMnemonic: In <radical>spring</radical>, your <radical>measurement</radical>s will reveal your <kanji>lifespan</kanji>. Only in spring can you measure your lifespan, just as easily as you measure your height and weight.
meaningInfo: On the first day of spring, all the girls and boys line up to measure their lifespans.
readingMnemonic: If your <kanji>lifespan</kanji> measurement isn't as long as you'd like, you need to drink more small <reading>ju</reading>ice (<ja>じゅ</ja>) boxes this year. They're good for your health, after all!
readingInfo: Look at Salmon, over here. She drank a thousand small juice boxes last year and now her measurement says she's gonna live another hundred years!
